# Update authentication and routing logic (2025-11-08 10:09Z)

_**User (2025-11-08 18:10Z)**_

Modify the authentication and routing logic so that:



When a user opens /, the app checks if they have a valid authToken and lastLogin stored in localStorage.



If both exist and lastLogin is within the last 7 days, redirect to /dashboard.



If not, redirect to /landing/index.html.



The landing and root (/) routes must always remain public and never trigger the /auth redirect.



All other routes should stay protected behind ProtectedRoute, which only redirects unauthenticated users (no token) to /auth.



Ensure ProtectedRoute uses useLocation().pathname and exempts / and /landing from redirection.



Clean up any mock user or default login values in AuthContext so user is null by default unless logged in.

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_



---

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: src/components/auth/RootRedirect.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 50, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,50 @@
- 
+ import { useEffect } from &quot;react&quot;;
+ import { useNavigate } from &quot;react-router-dom&quot;;
+ import { Loader2 } from &quot;lucide-react&quot;;
+ 
+ /**
+  * RootRedirect component handles the root (/) route logic:
+  * - Checks for authToken and lastLogin in localStorage
+  * - If both exist and lastLogin is within 7 days, redirects to /dashboard
+  * - Otherwise, redirects to /landing/index.html
+  */
+ export const RootRedirect = () =&gt; {
+   const navigate = useNavigate();
+ 
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     const checkAuthAndRedirect = () =&gt; {
+       const authToken = localStorage.getItem(&quot;authToken&quot;);
+       const lastLogin = localStorage.getItem(&quot;lastLogin&quot;);
+ 
+       // Check if both token and lastLogin exist
+       if (authToken &amp;&amp; lastLogin) {
+         const lastLoginTime = parseInt(lastLogin, 10);
+         const sevenDaysInMs = 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000; // 7 days in milliseconds
+         const now = Date.now();
+         const timeSinceLogin = now - lastLoginTime;
+ 
+         // If lastLogin is within the last 7 days, redirect to dashboard
+         if (timeSinceLogin &lt; sevenDaysInMs &amp;&amp; timeSinceLogin &gt;= 0) {
+           navigate(&quot;/dashboard&quot;, { replace: true });
+           return;
+         }
+       }
+ 
+       // Otherwise, redirect to landing page
+       window.location.href = &quot;/landing/index.html&quot;;
+     };
+ 
+     checkAuthAndRedirect();
+   }, [navigate]);
+ 
+   // Show loading state while checking and redirecting
+   return (
+     &lt;div className=&quot;min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center&quot;&gt;
+       &lt;div className=&quot;text-center&quot;&gt;
+         &lt;Loader2 className=&quot;h-8 w-8 animate-spin mx-auto mb-4&quot; /&gt;
+         &lt;p className=&quot;text-muted-foreground&quot;&gt;Loading...&lt;/p&gt;
+       &lt;/div&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   );
+ };
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
            setUser(validUser);
```

```diff
+           // Store authToken and lastLogin in localStorage if session exists
+           // This ensures the root route redirect logic works even on page refresh
+           if (initialSession?.access_token) {
+             localStorage.setItem(&quot;authToken&quot;, initialSession.access_token);
+             // Only update lastLogin if it doesn&#39;t exist or if we want to refresh it on each session restore
+             // For now, we&#39;ll only set it if it doesn&#39;t exist to preserve the original login time

+             }
+           } else {
```

```diff
        setSession(session);
        setUser(validUser);
+ 
+       // Update localStorage based on auth state changes
+       if (session?.access_token) {
+         localStorage.setItem(&quot;authToken&quot;, session.access_token);
+         // Update lastLogin on sign in events
+         if (event === &quot;SIGNED_IN&quot;) {
+           localStorage.setItem(&quot;lastLogin&quot;, Date.now().toString());
+         } else if (!localStorage.getItem(&quot;lastLogin&quot;)) {
+           // If session exists but lastLogin doesn&#39;t, set it (for restored sessions)
+           localStorage.setItem(&quot;lastLogin&quot;, Date.now().toString());
+         }
+       } else {
+         // Clear localStorage on sign out or token expiration
+         localStorage.removeItem(&quot;authToken&quot;);
+         localStorage.removeItem(&quot;lastLogin&quot;);
```

Updating the logic: on session restore, don't set `lastLogin` if it's missing; only set it on actual sign-in events so we preserve the original login time.


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: src/contexts/AuthContext.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**

## Summary of Changes

### 1. Created `RootRedirect` Component (`src/components/auth/RootRedirect.tsx`)
   - Checks `authToken` and `lastLogin` in localStorage
   - If both exist and `lastLogin` is within 7 days, redirects to `/dashboard`
   - Otherwise, redirects to `/landing/index.html`

### 2. Updated `AuthContext` (`src/contexts/AuthContext.tsx`)
   - On sign in: stores `authToken` (session access token) and `lastLogin` (timestamp) in localStorage
   - On sign out: clears `authToken` and `lastLogin` from localStorage
   - On session restore: updates `authToken` only (preserves original `lastLogin`)
   - Verified: user starts as `null` with no mock/default values

### 3. Updated `ProtectedRoute` (`src/components/auth/ProtectedRoute.tsx`)
   - Uses `useLocation().pathname` to get the current path
   - Exempts `/` and `/landing` routes from redirection
   - Redirects to `/auth` only if the user is null and the route is not exempt

### 4. Updated `App.tsx`
   - Replaced the protected root route with `RootRedirect`
   - Root route (`/`) is now public and handled by `RootRedirect`
   - Landing routes remain public (static files in `public/landing/`)

## How It Works

1. User opens `/`: `RootRedirect` checks localStorage
   - Valid token and recent login (< 7 days) → `/dashboard`
   - Otherwise → `/landing/index.html`

2. Landing and root routes: Always public, no `/auth` redirect

3. Protected routes: Require authentication
   - If not authenticated → `/auth`
   - Exemptions: `/` and `/landing` routes

4. Authentication flow:
   - Sign in sets `authToken` and `lastLogin` in localStorage
   - Sign out clears both values
   - `lastLogin` is only updated on actual sign-in events

All changes are implemented and lint checks pass. The authentication and routing logic now matches the requirements.

## Summary of Changes

### 1. Updated `RootRedirect` Component
   - Checks `authToken` and `lastLogin` in localStorage
   - If valid (within 7 days): redirects to `/dashboard`
   - If invalid or missing: renders the landing page in an iframe at `/` (URL stays `/`)

### 2. Updated `vercel.json`
   - Removed the rewrite from `/` to `/home` that conflicted with React Router
   - Landing page routes (`/landing/*`) serve static files from the public folder
   - All other routes fall back to `index.html` for React Router

## How It Works Now

1. User visits `/`:
   - If logged in (valid token + lastLogin < 7 days) → redirects to `/dashboard`
   - If not logged in → shows the landing page in an iframe; URL stays `/`

2. URL behavior:
   - Unauthenticated users: URL remains `/` while showing the landing page
   - Authenticated users: URL changes to `/dashboard`

3. All environments:
   - Works on localhost and production (Vercel, etc.)
   - Landing page static files are served correctly
   - React Router handles client-side routing

The iframe approach keeps the URL as `/` for unauthenticated users while displaying the landing page. Links within the landing page work within the iframe, so navigation should function as expected.

Changes applied:
1. Changed button text from "Request Demo" to "Sign In"
2. Changed href from `mailto:harshilsav1@gmail.com` to `/auth`
3. Removed `target="_blank" rel="noopener"` and added `target="_parent"` so the link navigates the parent window (the React app) when the page is in an iframe

The "Sign In" button now navigates to the `/auth` page. Since the landing page is in an iframe, `target="_parent"` ensures the parent React app navigates.

Adding a script before the closing `</body>` tag to override Framer’s dynamic content and keep the button as "Sign In":


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: public/landing/index.html</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 108, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -72,5 +72,112 @@
      
      &lt;!-- End of bodyEnd --&gt;
- 
+     &lt;script&gt;
+     // Override Framer&#39;s dynamic content to keep &quot;Sign In&quot; button
+     (function() {
+         function updateSignInButton() {
+             // Find the button by its href or by looking for &quot;Request Demo&quot; text
+             const allLinks = document.querySelectorAll(&#39;a[href=&quot;/auth&quot;], a[href*=&quot;mailto&quot;], a&#39;);
+             
+             allLinks.forEach(link =&gt; {
+                 const textContent = link.textContent.trim();
+                 
+                 // Check if this link contains &quot;Request Demo&quot; or is the sign-in button
+                 if (textContent === &#39;Request Demo&#39; || 
+                     (link.getAttribute(&#39;href&#39;) &amp;&amp; link.getAttribute(&#39;href&#39;).includes(&#39;mailto:harshilsav1@gmail.com&#39;))) {
+                     
+                     // Update the href
+                     link.setAttribute(&#39;href&#39;, &#39;/auth&#39;);
+                     link.setAttribute(&#39;target&#39;, &#39;_parent&#39;);
+                     link.removeAttribute(&#39;rel&#39;);
+                     
+                     // Update the text content
+                     const textElement = link.querySelector(&#39;p.framer-text, .framer-text, p&#39;);
+                     if (textElement) {
+                         textElement.textContent = &#39;Sign In&#39;;
+                     } else {
+                         link.textContent = &#39;Sign In&#39;;
+                     }
+                 }
+                 
+                 // Also check for the specific button structure we know about
+                 if (link.querySelector(&#39;p.framer-text[data-styles-preset=&quot;o8AwAvz9k&quot;]&#39;)) {
+                     const pElement = link.querySelector(&#39;p.framer-text[data-styles-preset=&quot;o8AwAvz9k&quot;]&#39;);
+                     if (pElement &amp;&amp; (pElement.textContent.trim() === &#39;Request Demo&#39; || link.getAttribute(&#39;href&#39;)?.includes(&#39;mailto&#39;))) {
+                         pElement.textContent = &#39;Sign In&#39;;
+                         link.setAttribute(&#39;href&#39;, &#39;/auth&#39;);
+                         link.setAttribute(&#39;target&#39;, &#39;_parent&#39;);
+                         link.removeAttribute(&#39;rel&#39;);
+                     }
+                 }
+             });
+         }
+         
+         // Run immediately
+         updateSignInButton();
+         
+         // Run after DOM is fully loaded
+         if (document.readyState === &#39;loading&#39;) {
+             document.addEventListener(&#39;DOMContentLoaded&#39;, updateSignInButton);
+         }
+         
+         // Run after a short delay to catch Framer&#39;s hydration
+         setTimeout(updateSignInButton, 100);
+         setTimeout(updateSignInButton, 500);
+         setTimeout(updateSignInButton, 1000);
+         setTimeout(updateSignInButton, 2000);
+         
+         // Use MutationObserver to watch for changes and update if needed
+         const observer = new MutationObserver(function(mutations) {
+             let shouldUpdate = false;
+             mutations.forEach(function(mutation) {
+                 if (mutation.type === &#39;childList&#39; || mutation.type === &#39;characterData&#39;) {
+                     // Check if &quot;Request Demo&quot; text was added
+                     if (mutation.target.textContent &amp;&amp; mutation.target.textContent.includes(&#39;Request Demo&#39;)) {
+                         shouldUpdate = true;
+                     }
+                     // Check if any added nodes contain &quot;Request Demo&quot;
+                     mutation.addedNodes.forEach(function(node) {
+                         if (node.nodeType === 1 &amp;&amp; (node.textContent &amp;&amp; node.textContent.includes(&#39;Request Demo&#39;))) {
+                             shouldUpdate = true;
+                         }
+                     });
+                 }
+                 
+                 // Check if href was changed back to mailto
+                 if (mutation.type === &#39;attributes&#39; &amp;&amp; mutation.attributeName === &#39;href&#39;) {
+                     const target = mutation.target;
+                     if (target.tagName === &#39;A&#39; &amp;&amp; target.getAttribute(&#39;href&#39;) &amp;&amp; target.getAttribute(&#39;href&#39;).includes(&#39;mailto:harshilsav1@gmail.com&#39;)) {
+                         shouldUpdate = true;
+                     }
+                 }
+             });
+             
+             if (shouldUpdate) {
+                 updateSignInButton();
+             }
+         });
+         
+         // Start observing when DOM is ready
+         if (document.body) {
+             observer.observe(document.body, {
+                 childList: true,
+                 subtree: true,
+                 characterData: true,
+                 attributes: true,
+                 attributeFilter: [&#39;href&#39;]
+             });
+         } else {
+             document.addEventListener(&#39;DOMContentLoaded&#39;, function() {
+                 observer.observe(document.body, {
+                     childList: true,
+                     subtree: true,
+                     characterData: true,
+                     attributes: true,
+                     attributeFilter: [&#39;href&#39;]
+                 });
+             });
+         }
+     })();
+     &lt;/script&gt;
  
  &lt;/body&gt;&lt;/html&gt;
```
